subject: Economics
subcategory: Economic Crises That Shook the World
title: Anatomy of Every Crisis: The Pattern That Never Changes
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Anatomy of Every Crisis: The Pattern That Never Changes.

hook.text: Tulips 1637. Railways 1845. Stocks 1929. Housing 2008. Crypto 2022. Different assets, identical human behavior.

buildup.text: Charles Kindleberger mapped the universal crisis pattern.

discovery.text: Every bubble starts with a real innovation. Then leverage amplifies it. Then greed detaches prices from reality.

twist.text: Knowing the pattern doesn't prevent it. Participants in every bubble believe 'this time is different.' It never is.

punchline.text: The four most expensive words in economics: 'This time is different.'
